posts.post_content: I remember buying a booster and getting this as a kid. For weeks I was convinced I wasn't "getting" something about the card, because it seemed so bad, and I couldn't understand why it was a rare. I didn't have much money, so I tried to build decks that included as many of my cards as I could, but I could never fathom including this one. Eventually I forgot about it entirely. Now, years later, coming back to Magic, I am angry and disappointed.
posts.html:
I remember buying a booster and getting this as a kid. For weeks I was convinced I wasn't "getting" something about the card, because it seemed so bad, and I couldn't understand why it was a rare. I didn't have much money, so I tried to build decks that included as many of my cards as I could, but I could never fathom including this one. Eventually I forgot about it entirely. Now, years later, coming back to Magic, I am angry and disappointed.

posts.post_content:
The biggest problem with the Leeches was that you wouldn't even get a considerably big body at the cost, but just a little advantage - that comes with a huge drawback.  
[Jade Leech](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Jade Leech) was the only somewhat interesting exception here, but was made uninteresting again by the fact that it requires two green mana to cast - which is why [Andradite Leech](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Andradite Leech) is ridiculous as well since its pump ability is highly conflicting with the drawback. And the cheap little [white](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=22960), [blue](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=23010) and red ones are all jokes.  
  
Aside from control-changing spells like [Donate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Donate) or [Confusion in the Ranks](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Confusion in the Ranks), and color-changing cards like [Painter's Servant](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Painter's Servant), [Alter Reality](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Alter Reality) or [Mind Bend](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mind Bend) this won't get really interesting even if you build around those Leeches.  
  
These could have come with one more power and tough... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
The biggest problem with the Leeches was that you wouldn't even get a considerably big body at the cost, but just a little advantage - that comes with a huge drawback.
Jade Leech was the only somewhat interesting exception here, but was made uninteresting again by the fact that it requires two green mana to cast - which is why Andradite Leech is ridiculous as well since its pump ability is highly conflicting with the drawback. And the cheap little white, blue and red ones are all jokes.

Aside from control-changing spells like Donate or Confusion in the Ranks, and color-changing cards like Painter's Servant, Alter Reality or Mind Bend this won't get really interesting even if you build around those Leeches.

These could have come with one more power and tough... (see all)
